newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: RTRS-Macmahon says first months on target.
newsitem.headline: RTRS-Macmahon says first months on target.

text.p: Contract mining group Macmahon Holding Ltd said on Thursday the opening months for the current year ending June 30, 1997 had produced profits in line with the group's forecast.

"The opening months of the current financial year has produced profits in line with the forecasts," Macmahon chairman David Munt told the annual meeting. "That is a material improvement on the 1996 results."

In its recent prospectus for a proposed A$44 million connverting preference share issue, Macmahon forecast pre-tax operating profit for 1996/97 would rise to A$23.8 million from A$15.74 million in 1995/96.
Munt told shareholders the group held a forward order book in excess of A$670 million in mining, civil engineering and quarying work.
"Your directors view the prospects for the 1996/97 year in a positive way," he said.
Shareholders are to vote on the share issue later today.
Macmahon shares were one cent firmer at 98 cents at 11.20 a.m. (0120 GMT).
